title: Annual Income and Age
question_text:
Consider the table below about annual income and age:
<25,000 25,001 < $x$ <50,000 50,001 < $x$ < 100,000 100,000 < $x$
Age under 30 37 31 14 1
Age 31-50 11 36 51 23
Age over 50 8 34 45 43


Researchers surveyed working adults and asked them their yearly income and age.
Based on this table, which of the following statements is true?
tables:
<25,00025,001 < $x$ <50,00050,001 < $x$ < 100,000100,000 < $x$
Age under 303731141
Age 31-5011365123
Age over 508344543

choices.text: About $36\%$ of people surveyed are between 31 and 50 years old.
According to this chart, I have about a $10.8\%$ chance of randomly finding, among working adults, a 31-50-year-old who earns between $\$25{,}001$ to $\$50{,}000$ per year.
A segmented bar graph would be an appropriate way to display this data.
It appears from this data that older people earn more money.
